content.description: This is route 15 from the Klosof guide: "Climb up featured face past a natural gear & a couple of bolts to crack on right. Follow crack on right with traditional gear to 2 bolt anchor."
content.protection: There are two bolts and lots of good places to place your own gear.  Anchors on top.
content.location: See the photo or guide.  This and "Top Rope" are next to each other in an area on the west side of Terrapin between the center wall and NE end.

content.description: This is route number 2 in the Klosof guide for Terrapin: "Climb up past bolts from top of notch straight up through groove at top, traverse right onto face, mantle up & climb to anchors. 8+ quick draws plus anchor."
content.location: The first 3 Terrapin routes (Ripples, Touch of Gray, Fade Away) start from the same 1st bolt.

content.description: This is number 14 in the Klosof guide: "Climb over large grainy huecos through roof & onto slab above. Continue up slab. Anchors accessed from the Virgin."
content.location: See the photo or guide.  This and "Virgin" are next to each other in an area on the west side of Terrapin between the center wall and NE end.

content.description:
#19 in the guidebook. The climb itself isn't terrible, but the location and condition of the anchor are questionable at best. The anchor is off to the climber's right and top-roping this route could damage a rope quite easily. As the guidebook says, it's probably best to belay followers from the top.

In addition, one anchor has been significantly eroded and both anchors are extremely loose. They have been placed on a rather hollow sounding flake to boot. This anchor is shared with 'Borrowed Shoe.' Use at your own risk!
content.protection: 5-6 draws, one long sling to reduce rope drag on final bolt to the anchor
content.location: See guidebook, it is pictured and easy to find

content.description: Great route to the summit of the Terrapin. Bolted for 2 pitches but can be done in one with either a two rope or double rap. Belay station at first anchor isn't great. Might as well do the whole thing in one shot and have the follower bring a second rope if you have the capability/draws. As per usual in this area, bring a 70m (and a spare if possible) or be prepared to get creative with a 60m
content.protection: 7-8 draws and anchor if doing in 2 pitches, 14+ and anchor if doing a single long pitch.
content.location: Terrapin Center Area. Starts right (West) of Bee Line. Bolts are obvious, two bolted anchor with chains for the first pitch can be easily seen from the ground. Second set of anchors at the top are obvious and you will rap from there as well.

content.description: Aptly named with much of the route under 5.7. All the fun is in the last 20 ft. Can get down with a 60m, but watch your ends if you have reason to believe your rope is short.
content.protection: Nice, shiny bolts the whole way, with anchors and rappel rings. Takes 8-10 quickdraws.
content.location: From the main trail, follow one of the many faint trails headed up and along the right-hand side (east) of Terrapin. Sandy Line is the obvious ramp/corner near the center of the formation.

content.description: Nice climb that starts halfway up the right side of the slab. 7 bolts to anchor.
content.location: Located on the right side of an alcove on the east face of the rock.

content.description: Starts up a slab before hitting the wall. Good rock. There is a large rock just left of the route near the top that is tempting to grab, but seems like it might one day shift. Afternoon shade.
content.protection: 5 Bolts.  Anchors with chains at top.
content.location: Located in an alcove on the east side of the rock.

content.description: This is route number 1 in the Klosof guide for Terrapin: "Climb up past bolts from top of notch up & left onto rounded arête continuing up featured face to anchors. 8+ quick draws plus anchor"
content.location: The first 3 Terrapin routes (Ripples, Touch of Gray, Fade Away) start from the same 1st bolt.

content.description: Follows a series of pockets up a narrow sluice like feature to a pair of anchors with chains. Fun climb, but can abrade a rope. Best belayed from top and rappelled down. 5-6 bolts.
content.location: Left most of the sluice like formations on the northeast aspect of the Terrapin.

content.description: From Klosof: "Climb thin right leaning crack past bolt & step left at top of seam to line of bolts. Continue up arête to anchors. 8-9 quick draws plus anchor."
content.location: This route is located on the center wall of Terrapin.  It is the right of "Dancin' in the Streets"

content.description: Short and Sweet! This is a fun climb that starts with smearing and mantling up a boulder, then up the tower full of honeycomb-looking shuteye chickenheads. Super fun climb, great for beginners and novice leaders. Could also be started from behind the boulder, but where's the fun in that? 60m rope ok on this one.
content.protection: 3-4 quick draws, long runner for the first bolt to reduce rope drag if starting on the ground. Two bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is not pictured in the online guidebook but is fairly obvious given the plethora of shuteye chicken heads and that it looks like a tower with a face on it. You can find it on the South East corner just to the North of the routes pictured in the book

content.description: Great route. Lots of fun climbing including slab, face, arete, and some crack. Shares a few bolts with Sandy Line and then moves up the adjacent face . Kind of a 'choose your own adventure'at the top. The crux is more mental than anything as there is a slightly run out section after you leave the slab with the potential to deck on the slab, however the climbing is easy and fun and an astute belayer can help minimize fall distance. As with any route in the Pins and Needles area, take a 70m rope and/or take two. 60m will work but you may have to get creative with it on other climbs in this area. Knot your ends!!
content.protection: Bolts are obvious and 7-8 quickdraws will work fine. 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the Terrapin Center Section and immediately right (West) of the Sandy Line and shares the first few bolts.

content.description: This is route number 3 in the Klosof guide for Terrapin: "Climb up past bolts from top of notch looking for line of bolts leading right. Follow bolts up & right to same anchor as Touch of Gray. 8+ quick draws plus anchor."  The lower half of this shares bolts with "Touch of Gray"
content.location: The first 3 Terrapin routes (Ripples, Touch of Gray, Fade Away) start from the same 1st bolt.

content.description: From Klosof: "Climb up to first bolt of Shakedown Street & traverse right to separate line of bolts. Continue up to rounded arête past face holds. Well protected, use a 60 meter rope to descend with one rope. 8-9 quick draws plus anchor."
content.location: This route is on the center wall of Terrapin. This shares the same start as Shakedown Street.

content.description: From Klosof: "Climb to pocket & follow bolt line to top. 5-6 quick draws plus long slings for shared anchor."
content.location: To the right of Sky Ladder.  This is number 20 on the Terrapin in Klosof's guide.

content.description: Fun route, start up the same slab as Sandy Line/Fall Line and shares the first (and maybe second) bolt. Crux is more of a mental one as there is a slightly tricky move where the slab meets the face and there is potential to deck on the slab below. After that its just face climbing. Can be done on Top Rope after leading Fall Line, best to run a few directional draws to reduce any swing.
content.location: Terrapin Center Area. Same anchor as Fall Line, to the right (West) of Sandy Line.

content.description: This is route number 4 in the Klosof guide for Terrapin: "Corner to right of first three routes until on top of back of Franklin’s Tower. Webbing may be found to descend. Not recommended."
content.location: This is on the far right of the first face when you approach Terrapin.  See the photo in the guidebook.  It is right of the first three bolted routes.
